WRITING.TITLE: German course
WRITING.TEXT: Hello guys! I'm moving to Nurnberg and i would like to know wich school can give me the best german course in nurnberg. My gf studied in Sudpunk and she says that is a great school but i would like to hear your opinion.
Ok, i want and i need to learn german like a mother tongue, I don't have limitations (i can go in the morning or in the afternoon). I don't know what else you mean for "what i'm looking for".
I have to start at A.1.1, i prefer an average age between 20 and 28, I don #8217;t care about cost, prefer small classes (max 10/15), intensive course
Perfect, thank you so much!

Can anyone help me?

WRITING.TITLE: Psychology in Germany
WRITING.TEXT: Hello everyone! My name is Valentino and i'm 24 y/o. I'm from Italy but I'm living in Germany (N #252;rnberg) right now. I have an Italian Bachelor degree in Psychology and I would like to ask some questions about Psychology and Germany. I would like to make my Master here in Germany (not in N #252;rnberg) but I would like first to make some practical experiences in the field of Psychology (I don't want to choose the "wrong" field). The fact is that I really can't find any job opportunities for me and I don't know what to do. Does someone know maybe if in other cities of Germany is the same soup? Btw I'm studying in a German language course and right now I have finished A2, but actually I'm probably B1-B2. Hope that someone can help me.
I want to make a Master but first I would like to make some practical work in the field of Psychology to understand better what I want to do. After I will choose wich Master.
I know, I meant in general not in this exact situation. I don't think it would be good for me to stay here in N #252;rnberg if there is no way I can make experience/make a master.
I know unfortunately. As I said I have finished A2 but I #8217;m at B1-B2 level in comprehension and speaking.

Thank you for the answer. I will try to contact clinics etc. I know that a Bachelor is nothing in fact I want and I will continue my studies. The problem is that in Italy (idk if it #8217;s the same in the rest of the EU/World) we don #8217;t do ANY practical experience in university. The highest practical experience that they made us do is learning to use Excel for transcribing some Psicometry problems, and write a final Thesis (not an empirical one). How can I know that I want to make #8220;X #8221; Master?
Yes I see it, but how can I decide what to study if I can #8217;t see in the real world at least something about the Psychology?
Because in Italy you can #8217;t try anything in Psychology, even with a Master. That #8217;s the reason why I moved.
Thank you for all the good advices! I will definitely contact some clinics! Thanks again.
Of course, I #8217;m actually enrolled in German language course and everyday I read books and hear podcast.
I know that, but not in N #252;rnberg. And even in the other cities when I see #8220;partikum #8221; they usually ask for a master
I don #8217;t know what to say... thank you for all your help, really
There is no way this is true, but I really hope it is
I think one of the best way to improove your vocabulary is watching Film/TV Series and read a lot of Books/News ect
Mmmh, maybe "How to sell drugs online"? It's in German too.

WRITING.TITLE: TV series
WRITING.TEXT: Hello People! I study the German language since October 2019 and right now I've finished course A2 (actually I've finished it in middle March but with covid pandemic every course has stopped). I think I have more knowledge than A2 (or at least more knowledge of my colleagues). I've read all the "Dino lernt Deutsch" without any kind of problems and I usually read news in German (with a little bit of problem, mainly word vocabulary). I would love to improve myself as much as possible so I was thinking to start a TV series. Right now I only know 2 names: Dark and How to sell drugs online. There is any chance I could follow one of this 2? Wich one do you reccomand? Obviously with German subtitles. Thank you in advance. P.S. I have "only" Netflix and PrimeVideos.
Thank you for your answer. I heard that Dark was a little bit complicated but I asked anyway here because I trust this comunity. So with my level do you think it would be better Babylon Berlin?
Actually they are more. If I #8217;m not mistaken they are 8

WRITING.TITLE: Best self study Book/Course
WRITING.TEXT: Hi everyone! I want to ask you all some advices for the best (or the bests) self study German course/book in the market. I followed a German language course in Germany from A1 to the beginning of B1 but with this pandemic every course got cancelled. For that I decided to continue the study by myself but the most of books are structured for Courses with groups of people. P.S. I don't know if it's helpful but I used the "Schritte" series in my course and I loved it but it's structured obviously for a group of people. I found [this](https://www.amazon.de/-/en/Hueber-Sprachkurs-Deutsch-Englische-Ausgabe/dp/3192494751/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1 amp;keywords=german+b1+self+study amp;qid=1589131628 amp;sr=8-1) but it has no review ect.

I found this too in a post here in this sub and i liked it a lot, but I tought that it would be better to take a book studied for group teaching. I don't know, I'm not a teacher so I honestly I don't know
It #8217;s for self study or for group/course learning?
Thanks for the info

WRITING.TITLE: Offering: Italian; Seeking: German.
WRITING.TEXT: Hi everyone, I #8217;m 24y/o from Italy who lives right now in Germany. I have a Psychology bachelor degree and I would like to take a Master degree in Germany. I #8217;ve followed a language course since A2 but then Corona blocked every course. I love Music, Film/TVSeries, Technology but most of all Psychology. Hope that I can find someone who wants to help me and that I can help. Hope to hear from you soon!
I followed language course in Germany. Each course was 1 month long so it took me approximately 4 months.

I #8217;m not sure where I will be working but I know that I love cognitive psychology. The problem is that volunteering is not an option for me because I need money to live here in Germany. For that I need to work but I would like to make a job experience at least a little bit relevant in psychology .

I use the projector as my main media consumer (I have no TV at all so I watch everything on it) and I would also like to use it for some gaming. Do you have any top pick that in your opinion is the best projector for around 300 #8364;?
I #8217;m always scared about used product but I #8217;ll check. Why there is nothing good new?
Make sense. And do you know any trustworthy website specific for projectors where I can check used products, or should I go on amazon / eBay?
I can #8217;t edit the title anymore, I live in Europe, right now in Germany and I #8217;ve studied for my Bachelor #8217;s degree in Psychology in Italy.

WRITING.TITLE: Too many paths [EU][Germany]
WRITING.TEXT: Hi people, I #8217;m 24 y/o and last year I finished my bachelor #8217;s degree in psychology in Italy. I #8217;ve moved to Germany because I wanted to live elsewhere and Germany seems a great option. I finally found a job as Assistant technical psychologist in a private clinic and now I #8217;m wondering what will be my next step. I, as I #8217;m sure everyone here, love psychology from the bottom of my heart, any field it #8217;s really beautiful for me and that #8217;s the reason of my indecision. I mostly love the Cognitive, Neuro-cognitive and Behavioural aspects of psychology, but I #8217;m also really curious about clinical psychotherapist and so on. Also, and I know that all of what I #8217;m saying is part of different paths, I #8217;m really interested in Human Resources and in general the psychology inside big company (especially Tech company). Working in this clinic it #8217;s nice, because I #8217;m working at least in a field where I belong, but it #8217;s too little for me! I get bored after a while always to use software with patients because I feel that I #8217;m not having that big of an impact. I would love to continue my studies but I have no idea how to chose a path, the right path. During my life I developed one of my greatest fear: taking the wrong path and wasting time (which I know it #8217;s never wasted of course, but I think you know what I mean), for that I #8217;m speaking to all of you hoping that I could find help. I #8217;m so sorry for the long post and I wish all of you people a great day!
